Paragraph.Text: ensure that at all times during the diving operation each diving crew involved in the diving operation includes a hyperbaric first-aid technician available on the craft or installation from which the diving operation is conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: arrange for the services, on a 24 hour a day basis, of a specialized diving doctor, referred to in paragraph 4(3)(d), who is familiar with the diving procedures to be used in the diving operation and who is within a travelling distance of the diving operation that is acceptable to the Minister, to provide medical assistance in the event of an emergency;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that an adequate means of communication exists on a 24 hour a day basis between

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the diving station, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the craft or installation from which the diving operation is being conducted

ContinuedParagraph.Text: and the specialized diving doctor referred to in paragraph (b); and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: locate the nearest surface compression chamber that is compatible with the equipment used in the diving operation and that is suitable for the type, depth and duration of the diving operation to be conducted and shall make arrangements for the use of that surface compression chamber in the event of an emergency.

Section.Text: No diving contractor who conducts a diving operation shall use or permit to be used a craft in the dynamically positioned mode in the diving operation unless that use was specifically approved in accordance with section 5 for the diving program of which the diving operation is a part and the following requirements are complied with:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the craft is so designed and constructed that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: more than one prime mover is available for each fore, aft and thwartship thruster,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the event of the failure of any prime mover or manoeuvring unit of the craft, the position of the craft can be maintained during the period it would take for the safe recovery of divers,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the arrangement of the thrusters and their size and number enable, in the event of the loss of any thruster of the craft, the heading and the position of the craft to be maintained within the environmental and operational capacity limits of that craft for the time it takes to safely recover any skip, diving bell or ADS used in the diving operation,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: for each manoeuvring unit necessary to maintain the craft in the dynamically positioned mode, other than the propellers and energy plant units, there is a reserve duplicate unit and an automatic and a manual system to switch from the on-line unit to the duplicate unit,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the supervisor on duty at the diving station on the craft can, by means of an alarm system connecting the bridge of the craft to the diving station on the craft, be kept informed by the person who controls the dynamic positioning system of any station-keeping problems or any other problems that might affect the safety of the diving operation,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a computer system controls the dynamic positioning of the craft and another independent, duplicate computer system is available to take over control automatically in the event of failure of the on-line computer system,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: there are on line at least two reference systems independently linked into each computer system referred to in subparagraph (vi),

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: during any time that a person involved in the diving operation is in the water

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a person who is responsible for the navigation of the craft and a person who is responsible for the control of the dynamic positioning system are in the control room of the craft,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the machinery spaces of the craft, except those in the pontoons of a semi-submersible craft, are manned, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in any one manoeuvre, the craft is not moved more than 5 m or the heading of the craft is not changed more than 5°, whichever is the lesser movement in relation to the location of the dive site of the diving operation; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any person who is responsible for the control of the dynamic positioning system of the craft has at least six months experience using both the manual and the automatic modes of that particular system or, where that is impracticable, of a similar system, and at least two weeks briefing by the designer or manufacturer of the craft on the behaviour and hydrodynamics of that craft when operating in the dynamically positioned mode.

Subsection.Text: No operator, pursuant to paragraph 6(1)(a), or diving contractor, pursuant to subsection 9(1), shall engage the services of a person as a diving safety specialist unless the person holds a diving supervisor’s certificate that is issued pursuant to section 71 and that is appropriate to the category of dive in respect of which that person will be giving advice and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has passed a test that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is acceptable to the Minister; and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: indicates that the person has an adequate knowledge of the safety, personnel, technical, operational, management, marketing and regulatory aspects of diving operations appropriate to the category of diving supervisor’s certificate that person holds; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: until December 31, 1990, has satisfied the Minister that the person’s knowledge is equivalent to the knowledge described in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: A person who has been engaged as a diving safety specialist for a diving program by an operator, pursuant to paragraph 6(1)(a), shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: advise the operator on all safety aspects of the diving program including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the application for authorization, under paragraph 3.2(1)(b) of the Act, for the diving program,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any application made by the operator for authorization pursuant to subsection 12.2(1) of the Act, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: any decision by the operator to interrupt or discontinue the diving program or any portion of the diving program for safety reasons; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be available on a 24 hour a day basis to advise any person involved in the diving program, including persons making decisions affecting the safety of divers involved in the diving program, on the safety aspects of the diving program.

Subsection.Text: A person who has been engaged as a diving safety specialist for a diving operation by a diving contractor, pursuant to subsection 9(1), shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: advise the diving contractor on all safety aspects of the diving operation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be available on a 24 hour a day basis to advise any person involved in the diving operation, including any person making decisions affecting the safety of divers involved in the diving operation, on all safety aspects of the diving operation.

Subsection.Text: A diving safety specialist referred to in subsection (2) or (3) shall, in advising any person pursuant to those subsections, take into account as a primary consideration the safety of any divers involved in the diving program or diving operation, as the case may be.

Heading.TitleText: Supervision of a Category I Diving Operation

Section.Text: No person shall supervise a category I diving operation unless the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has been appointed in writing pursuant to paragraph 9(3)(a);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has been certified to be medically fit

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: to dive, in accordance with paragraph 53(b), or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: to supervise by a medical doctor who has examined the person not more than 12 months prior to the date on which the diving operation is to be conducted and who has recorded the results of the examination on a medical examination record in the form set out in Schedule V, or another form acceptable to the Minister, and in a diving supervisor’s medical certificate in that person’s supervisor’s logbook, referred to in section 51;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: holds a valid diving supervisor’s certificate issued pursuant to section 28, 30, 32 or 71, or a valid document that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: issued by a country other than Canada on the basis of training and experience that are equivalent to the training and experience required of a person to obtain a certificate pursuant to section 28, 30 or 32, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: acceptable to the Minister; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: has satisfied the diving contractor who conducts the diving operation that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person has sufficient diving and supervisory experience and adequate knowledge in the use of the diving plant and equipment to be used in the diving operation, or a similar type of diving plant and equipment, and the breathing mixture to be used in the diving operation, and is familiar with the relevant provisions of the procedures manual referred to in paragraph 4(4)(a) and the contingency plan referred to in paragraph 4(4)(i) to be used in the diving operation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person’s involvement in the diving operation is in no way contrary to any restriction, pursuant to section 35, in that person’s supervisor’s certificate or attached to that person’s document referred to in paragraph (c).

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on application, issue a category I diving supervisor’s certificate that is valid for one year to a person who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: been, for at least three years, the holder of a category I diving certificate issued pursuant to section 54 or 71, or a document that is

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: issued by a country other than Canada on the basis of training and experience that are equivalent to the training and experience required of a person to obtain a certificate pursuant to section 54, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: acceptable to the Minister,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: been, during the 12 months preceding the application, an assistant diving supervisor for at least 16 category I dives and has supervised at least two real or mock incidents involving decompression sickness,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: submitted to the Minister a letter of recommendation that is in the form set out in Schedule VI and is signed by a diving contractor or operator and by a diving supervisor, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: passed a test acceptable to the Minister for a category I diving supervisor’s certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: held a category I diving supervisor’s certificate that was issued pursuant to this subsection but is no longer valid because it was not renewed pursuant to subsection (2) and who meets the requirements of subparagraphs (a)(ii) and (iii); or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: until December 31, 1990, has satisfied the Minister that the person’s training and experience are equivalent to the training and experience required of a person to obtain a certificate pursuant to paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on application by the holder of a category I diving supervisor’s certificate issued pursuant to subsection (1), renew the certificate for a period of one year where the holder of that certificate has supervised at least 12 category I dives and at least two real or mock incidents involving decompression sickness during the 12 months preceding the application.

Heading.TitleText: Supervision of a Category II Diving Operation

Section.Text: No person shall supervise a category II diving operation unless the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has been appointed in writing pursuant to paragraph 9(3)(b);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meets the criteria set out in paragraphs 27(b) and (d); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: holds a valid diving supervisor’s certificate issued pursuant to section 30, 32 or 71, or a valid document that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: issued by a country other than Canada on the basis of training and experience that are equivalent to the training and experience required of a person to obtain a certificate pursuant to section 30 or 32, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: acceptable to the Minister.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on application, issue a category II diving supervisor’s certificate that is valid for one year to a person who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: been, for at least two years, the holder of a category II diving certificate issued pursuant to section 56 or 71, or a document that is

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: issued by a country other than Canada on the basis of training and experience that are equivalent to the training and experience required of a person to obtain a certificate pursuant to section 56, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: acceptable to the Minister,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: been, during the 12 months preceding the application, an assistant diving supervisor for at least six category II dives and 10 category I dives and has supervised at least two real or mock incidents involving decompression sickness,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: submitted to the Minister a letter of recommendation that is in the form set out in Schedule VI and is signed by a diving contractor or operator and by a diving supervisor who holds a category II or III diving supervisor’s certificate, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: passed a test acceptable to the Minister for a category II diving supervisor’s certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: held a category II diving supervisor’s certificate that was issued pursuant to this subsection but is no longer valid because it was not renewed pursuant to subsection (2) and who meets the requirements of subparagraphs (a)(ii) and (iii); or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: until December 31, 1990, has satisfied the Minister that the person’s training and experience are equivalent to the training and experience required of a person to obtain a certificate pursuant to paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on application by the holder of a category II diving supervisor’s certificate issued pursuant to subsection (1), renew the certificate for a period of one year where the holder of that certificate has supervised at least 12 dives, of which at least six were category II dives, and has supervised at least two real or mock incidents involving decompression sickness during the 12 months preceding the application.

Heading.TitleText: Supervision of a Category III Diving Operation

Section.Text: No person shall supervise a category III diving operation unless the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has been appointed in writing pursuant to paragraph 9(3)(c);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meets the criteria set out in paragraphs 27(b) and (d); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: holds a valid category III diving supervisor’s certificate issued pursuant to section 32 or 71, or a valid document that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: issued by a country other than Canada on the basis of training and experience that is equivalent to the training and experience required of a person to obtain a certificate pursuant to section 32, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: acceptable to the Minister.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on application, issue a category III diving supervisor’s certificate that is valid for one year to a person who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: been, for at least two years, the holder of a category III diving certificate issued pursuant to section 58 or 71, or a document that is

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: issued by a country other than Canada on the basis of training and experience that are equivalent to the training and experience required of a person to obtain a certificate pursuant to section 58, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: acceptable to the Minister,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: been, during the 12 months preceding the application, an assistant diving supervisor for at least 16 dives of which at least two were saturation dives and six were category II dives and has supervised at least two real or mock incidents involving decompression sickness,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: submitted to the Minister a letter of recommendation that is in the form set out in Schedule VI and is signed by a diving contractor or operator and by two diving supervisors each of whom holds a category III diving supervisor’s certificate, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: passed a test acceptable to the Minister for a category III diving supervisor’s certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: held a category III diving supervisor’s certificate that was issued pursuant to this subsection but is no longer valid because it was not renewed pursuant to subsection (2) and who meets the requirements of subparagraphs (a)(ii) and (iii); or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: until December 31, 1990, has satisfied the Minister that the person’s training and experience are equivalent to the training and experience required of a person to obtain a certificate pursuant to paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on application by the holder of a category III diving supervisor’s certificate issued pursuant to subsection (1), renew the certificate for a period of one year where the holder of that certificate has supervised at least 12 dives of which at least one was a saturation dive and at least six were category II dives and has supervised at least two real or mock incidents involving decompression sickness during the 12 months preceding the application.

Heading.TitleText: Supervision of an ADS Diving Operation

Section.Text: No person shall supervise an ADS diving operation unless the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has been appointed in writing pursuant to paragraph 9(3)(d);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meets the criteria set out in paragraph 27(b) and subparagraph 27(d)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has satisfied the diving contractor who conducts the diving operation that the person has sufficient pilot and ADS supervisory experience and adequate knowledge in the use of the type of ADS to be used in the diving operation and is familiar with the relevant provisions of the procedures manual referred to in paragraph 4(4)(a) and the contingency plan referred to in paragraph 4(4)(i) to be used in the diving operation; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: holds a valid ADS supervisor’s certificate issued pursuant to section 34 or 71, or a valid document that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: issued by a country other than Canada on the basis of training and experience that are equivalent to the training and experience required of a person to obtain a certificate pursuant to section 34, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: acceptable to the Minister.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on application, issue an ADS supervisor’s certificate that is valid for one year to a person who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: been, for at least three years, the holder of a pilot’s certificate issued pursuant to section 65 or 71, or a document that is

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: issued by a country other than Canada on the basis of training and experience that is equivalent to the training and experience required of a person to obtain a certificate pursuant to section 65, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: acceptable to the Minister,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: made at least 20 ADS dives with a total bottom time of at least 80 hours, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: submitted to the Minister a letter of recommendation that is signed by a diving contractor or operator and by an ADS supervisor and that is acceptable to the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: held an ADS supervisor’s certificate that was issued pursuant to this subsection but is no longer valid because it was not renewed pursuant to subsection (2) and has supervised at least 10 ADS dives with a total bottom time of at least 25 hours during the 12 months preceding the application; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: until December 31, 1990, has satisfied the Minister that the person’s training and experience are equivalent to the training and experience required of a person to obtain a certificate pursuant to paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on application by the holder of an ADS supervisor’s certificate issued pursuant to subsection (1), renew the certificate for a period of one year where the holder of the certificate has supervised at least six ADS dives with a total bottom time of at least 20 hours during the 12 months preceding the application.

Heading.TitleText: Restrictions Respecting Supervisor’s Certificate and Document

Subsection.Text: The Minister may insert in a supervisor’s certificate issued pursuant to section 28, 30, 32, 34 or 71, or attach to a document referred to in subparagraph 28(1)(a)(i), 30(1)(a)(i), 32(1)(a)(i) or 34(1)(a)(i), restrictions with respect to the supervision of a diving operation by the holders of the certificate or the document where the Minister considers such restrictions necessary for safety reasons.

Where the Minister inserts a restriction in a certificate or attaches a restriction to a document, pursuant to subsection (1), the Minister shall give the holder of the certificate or the document, as the case may be, an opportunity to show cause why the restriction should not be so inserted or attached.

The Minister may invalidate a supervisor’s certificate issued pursuant to section 28, 30, 32, 34 or 71 where, in the opinion of the Minister, the holder of the certificate has become incompetent or incapacitated.

Where the Minister proposes to invalidate a supervisor’s certificate pursuant to subsection (1), the Minister shall give the holder of the certificate at least 30 days’ notice in writing setting out the reasons for the proposed invalidation and shall give the holder an opportunity to show cause why the certificate should not be invalidated.
No diving supervisor shall, in a diving operation supervised by the diving supervisor, permit a person to make

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a category I dive in the diving operation unless the person meets the criteria set out in section 53, 55 or 57;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a category II dive in the diving operation unless the person meets the criteria set out in section 55 or 57; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a category III dive in the diving operation unless the person meets the criteria set out in section 57.

Subsection.Text: No ADS supervisor shall, in an ADS diving operation supervised by the ADS supervisor, permit a person to make an ADS dive in the diving operation unless the person meets the criteria set out in section 64.

No supervisor shall, in a diving operation under his supervision, permit a person to be involved in the diving operation where the supervisor believes on reasonable grounds that the person is unfit to be involved in that diving operation or that the involvement of that person in the diving operation could compromise the safety of other persons involved in the diving operation.
A diving supervisor shall plan dives in such a manner that the total bottom time of a diver supervised by the supervisor does not exceed, in any 24 hour period,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a category I dive

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: five hours at depths of 20 m or less, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: three hours at depths of more than 20 m;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a category II dive, three hours; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a category III dive, eight hours.

Subsection.Text: A diving supervisor shall plan a diving operation in such a manner that, where practicable, a diving bell is used in the diving operation for any dive to a depth of more than 30 m that requires surface decompression.
An ADS supervisor shall ensure that a pilot supervised by the supervisor does not remain underwater, in any 24 hour period, for more than a total of eight hours.
A supervisor shall ensure that, following a dive under his supervision, the diver or pilot who made the dive has an adequate rest period.

The supervisor of a diving operation shall be present at the diving station from which the diving operation is controlled at all times during the diving operation or during the period in which the supervisor is on duty, as the case may be, and shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: directly control the diving operation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: use, during the total dive time of the diving operation, a sufficient number of trained persons to operate the diving plant and equipment used in that diving operation; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: follow the relevant provisions of the applicable procedures manual for that diving operation.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding any other provision of these Regulations, the supervisor of a diving operation may, in the case of an emergency, allow or direct the use of diving techniques, equipment and procedures not permitted by these Regulations where that use provides the only available practicable means of ensuring or enhancing the safety of the persons involved in the diving operation.
The supervisor of a diving operation shall interrupt or discontinue the diving operation where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: continuation of the diving operation would or is likely to compromise the safety of any person involved in the diving operation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the water currents at the underwater work site of the diving operation are likely to compromise the safety of a diver or pilot involved in the diving operation; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: combustible material is stored too close for safety to any diving plant and equipment used in the diving operation.

Subsection.Text: The supervisor of a diving operation that involves the use of a diving submersible shall, where practicable, discontinue the diving operation where the unused stored electrical power of the diving submersible reaches 20 per cent of the electrical power capacity of the diving submersible, excluding the back-up capability referred to in paragraph 14(c).

Where the supervisor of a diving operation wishes to commence or continue the diving operation and the person in charge of the craft or installation from which the diving operation is being conducted considers that the commencement or continuation of the diving operation would compromise the safety of any person on the craft or installation or the safety of the craft or installation, the decision of the person in charge of the craft or installation respecting the commencement or continuation of the diving operation shall overrule the supervisor’s decision.
In the event of an accident, the supervisor of the diving operation shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take such measures as are necessary to provide treatment to any person injured in the accident and to ensure the safety of the persons involved in the diving operation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: interrupt the diving operation or any portion of the diving operation that may have caused or contributed to the accident until the diving operation or portion of the diving operation can be safely resumed;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: deliver the diving operations logbook referred to in paragraph 9(5)(m) to the operator responsible for the diving operation as soon as possible after the accident;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: keep the site of the accident undisturbed until a conservation engineer has completed inspection of the site;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: prepare a written report that contains a description of the accident, a summary of the events that led to the accident and the measures taken following the accident; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: deliver to the operator responsible for the diving operation the report referred to in paragraph (e).

Subsection.Text: No supervisor shall conduct a diving operation unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prior to the commencement of a dive that is part of the diving operation, the supervisor has consulted the person in charge of the craft or installation from which the diving operation will be conducted and any other person whose assistance the supervisor considers necessary for the dive;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the supervisor has taken into account, in any decision respecting the diving operation, the meteorological data available to the supervisor and the environmental conditions in the area of the proposed dive site;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: protective headgear is available for any diver involved in the diving operation at any time that the diver is at or below the surface of the water and, where practicable, at any time the diver is transported in a skip;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: during any period of darkness or low visibility

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any diver involved in the diving operation is provided with, and has attached to the diver’s person, a lamp or other suitable device that indicates the diver’s location, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: where the nature of the diving operation permits, the dive site and the underwater work site of the diving operation is adequately illuminated;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any standby diver involved in the diving operation has an umbilical at least 3 m longer than the umbilical of the diver for whom the stand-by diver acts as stand-by;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the divers and pilots involved in the diving operation are protected from any danger or hazards that could be caused by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: sonar,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: devices emitting electromagnetic or ionizing radiation,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the propeller and the manoeuvring unit of any craft from which the diving operation is being conducted and the flows of water created by the propeller and the manoeuvering unit,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the normal movements of a craft referred to in subparagraph (iii) and any movements of the craft caused by unexpected loss of power or stability,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: any suction or water current encountered in or resulting from the diving operation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: equipment on a craft or an installation from which the diving operation is being conducted; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: plans have been made, in the event a craft from which the diving operation is being conducted loses power, to protect and to recover a diver or pilot involved in the diving operation who is in the water.

Subsection.Text: No diving supervisor shall permit a diver supervised by the supervisor to enter the water unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the diver

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is wearing a diving harness complete with a pelvic support and lifting ring and is equipped, where practicable, with a depth indicator capable of being monitored from the surface, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: has a bale-out gas bottle that is independent of the primary supply of breathing mixture to the diver; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: all impressed current cathodic protection devices situated within a radius of 5 m from the diver’s underwater work site are deactivated and the notice referred to in subparagraph 6(1)(g)(ii) is prominently displayed on the controls of those devices, or other equally effective measures are taken to ensure the safety of any diver within a radius of 5 m of any active impressed current cathodic protection devices.

Subsection.Text: No diving supervisor shall permit a diver supervised by the supervisor to make a dive that is part of a diving operation from

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a place referred to in paragraph 6(1)(b) that is unsuitable;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a craft that has insufficient power or stability for the safe conduct of the dive;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a dive site located more than 2 m above the water unless a suitable skip, diving bell or diving submersible is used to transport the diver through the air-water interface;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a dynamically positioned craft unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the craft has been operating in the dynamically positioned mode for at least 30 minutes before the diver enters the water,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the range of surge or sway movement of the water at the dive site is less than 80 per cent of the maximum operational capacity limit of the craft,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a skip or a diving bell is positioned as close as possible to the diver’s underwater work site,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: all reasonable precautions are taken to prevent any umbilical used in the dive from coming into contact with any propeller or manoeuvring unit of the craft,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: any change of heading or positioning of the craft, at any time a diver involved in the diving operation is in the water, is made only after the diving supervisor has granted permission for the change and the diver has been notified, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the craft complies with the requirements of section 25; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a craft that is under way, except in the case of an emergency.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), a craft that is operating in the dynamically positioned mode and that complies with the requirements of section 25 is not considered to be under way.

No supervisor shall conduct a diving operation unless the person in charge of the craft or installation from which the diving operation is to be conducted has been notified of the proposed diving operation.

Section.Text: No diving supervisor shall use or permit to be used SCUBA in a diving operation supervised by the supervisor except where any other diving technique is impracticable or hazardous to use and unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the diving operation is conducted in water that is less than 20 m deep;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the diving operation can be completed without the need for decompression;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the diver using SCUBA is connected to a lifeline or, where the use of a lifeline is impracticable,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the diver is in contact, visually or orally, with another diver who is in the water, securely connected to a lifeline and assisted by an attendant at the dive site, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: some other effective method of ensuring that diver’s safety is provided;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: there is a practical means of communication between the supervisor and the diver using SCUBA and there is a means of oral communication between the supervisor and other personnel involved in the diving operation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the diving crew for the duration of the diving operation includes a minimum of one supervisor, one diver, one stand-by diver and as many attendants as the supervisor considers necessary to ensure the safety of the divers involved in the diving operation; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: all applicable provisions of these Regulations are complied with.

Heading.TitleText: Restrictions Respecting Category I Diving Operations

Section.Text: No diving supervisor shall conduct a category I diving operation, other than a diving operation in which SCUBA is used, unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a suitable skip is used to transport the divers involved in the diving operation to an underwater work site that is 20 m or more in depth and, where practicable, to an underwater work site that is less than 20 m in depth;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an umbilical directly from the surface or via a skip is used to supply the appropriate breathing mixture to the divers involved in the dive that is part of the diving operation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the supervisor is in oral communication with any divers, stand-by divers and attendants involved in the diving operation at all times during the diving operation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the supervisor has a means of monitoring the depth of each diver involved in the diving operation and the pressure of the breathing mixture being supplied to each diver and stand-by diver involved in the dive;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: each diver involved in the dive is securely connected to a lifeline; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the diving crew for the duration of the diving operation, includes one diving supervisor, one diver and a minimum of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: one stand-by diver equipped with an umbilical at least 3 m longer than the umbilical of the diver for whom the stand-by diver acts as stand-by,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: one attendant at the dive site of the diving operation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: as many additional attendants as the supervisor considers necessary to ensure the safety of the divers involved in the diving operation.

Heading.TitleText: Restrictions Respecting Category II Diving Operations

Section.Text: No diving supervisor shall conduct a category II diving operation unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the requirements referred to in paragraphs 42(c) to (e) are complied with;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a diving bell or diving submersible is used for any descent or ascent of a diver to or from the underwater work site of the diving operation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the diving supervisor has a means of monitoring the internal pressure of any diving bell or surface compression chamber or the compression chamber of any diving submersible used in the diving operation; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the diving crew, for the duration of the diving operation, includes one diving supervisor and a minimum of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: two divers who are in the diving bell or diving submersible used in the diving operation, one of whom is equipped with an umbilical at least 3 m longer than the umbilical of the diver for whom the stand-by diver acts as stand-by,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: one additional stand-by diver and one attendant at the dive site of the diving operation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: as many additional attendants as the supervisor considers necessary to ensure the safety of the divers involved in the diving operation.

Heading.TitleText: Restrictions Respecting Category III Diving Operations

Subsection.Text: No diving supervisor shall, in a saturation dive supervised by the supervisor, permit the total dive time of any diver involved in the dive to exceed 31 days.

No diving supervisor shall conduct a category III diving operation unless the diving crew, for the duration of the dive, includes the persons referred to in paragraph 43(d) and as many additional specialists and life-support technicians as the diving supervisor considers necessary to ensure the safety of the divers involved in the dive.

Section.Text: No diving supervisor shall make a dive while supervising a diving operation, even in the case of an emergency.

Subsection.Text: Where a skip, diving bell, diving submersible or ADS used in a diving operation is being lowered into or raised from the water, the supervisor of the diving operation shall ensure that the skip, diving bell, diving submersible or ADS, as the case may be, is continuously within the supervisor’s vision, either directly or by any other means.

Where, in a diving operation, a diving bell is coupled with a surface compression chamber by means of a clamping mechanism, the supervisor of the diving operation shall permit only a person who is familiar with the operational procedures designed for the clamping mechanism to operate that clamping mechanism.

Where, in a diving operation, a person is transferred to or from a diving bell, the supervisor of the diving operation shall ensure that any surface compression chambers used in the diving operation but not used in the transfer are, during the transfer, isolated from the surface compression chambers used in the transfer.

Where a diver involved in a diving operation exhibits any unusual psychological or physiological symptoms or any severe symptoms of decompression sickness, the diving supervisor of the diving operation shall advise the specialized diving doctor referred to in paragraph 4(3)(d) and the operator responsible for that diving operation of those symptoms and shall supervise any therapeutic recompression or decompression of the diver.
A diving supervisor shall take all reasonable precautions to ensure that, except in the event of the evacuation of a diver during a diving operation supervised by the diving supervisor,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a diver involved in the diving operation who has completed a dive does not fly in an aircraft

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for 12 hours following a non-decompression dive,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for 24 hours following decompression, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for such longer period as the diving supervisor considers necessary to ensure that the diver does not suffer decompression sickness; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a diver involved in the diving operation who has completed a saturation dive remains under observation in the general area of the decompression chamber for at least 24 hours after decompression or such longer period as is sufficient in the opinion of the diving supervisor to ensure the well-being of the diver.

Subsection.Text: A diving supervisor shall take all reasonable precautions to ensure that, in the evacuation of a person during a diving operation supervised by the supervisor, a person involved in the diving operation who has completed decompression within the preceding 24 hours does not fly in an aircraft at an altitude greater than is operationally necessary in the circumstances.
No supervisor shall conduct a diving operation unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the diving plant and equipment referred to in paragraph 9(5)(h) meets the relevant requirements of sections 12 to 21, is available for use when required and that diving plant and equipment, other than diving plant and equipment intended to be mobile during the diving operation, is, at all times during the diving operation, firmly secured to the craft or installation from which the diving operation is conducted; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any electrically operated diving plant and equipment that is used in the diving operation is suitable for the location in which it is to be used and is protected from hazards caused by water and environmental conditions.

Subsection.Text: No supervisor shall, in a diving operation supervised by the supervisor, use any diving plant and equipment in the diving operation unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the appropriate examinations and tests referred to in subsection 11(1) have been carried out on the diving plant and equipment and the certificates related to those examinations and tests have been inserted into or attached to the register referred to in subsection 11(3); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the supervisor has, not more than 24 hours before such use,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: examined the diving plant and equipment in accordance with the relevant provisions of the applicable procedures manual and found it to be in good working order, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: where appropriate, in addition to the examination referred to in subparagraph (i), tested for leaks any pump, compressor, cylinder or pipeline used in the diving operation to convey breathing mixture and found it free from leaks.

Subsection.Text: No diving supervisor shall conduct a dive unless a two-compartment compression chamber

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that has been approved in accordance with section 5 for the diving program of which the dive is a part, to be used at a pressure that is not less than six atmospheres absolute and, where the maximum working pressure that may be encountered during the dive is greater than six atmospheres absolute, at the maximum working pressure plus one atmosphere, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is suitable for the dive

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is located in a readily accessible place on board the craft or installation from which the dive is conducted, except where the dive is conducted at a depth of 10 m or less, in which case the compression chamber may be located within one hour’s travelling time from the dive site.

Heading.TitleText: Oxygen Supply Systems and Breathing Mixture Supply Systems

Subsection.Text: No supervisor shall conduct a diving operation in which

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an oxygen supply system is used unless the oxygen supply system meets the requirements set out in section 19;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a breathing mixture supply system is used unless the breathing mixture supply system meets the requirements set out in sections 20 and 21; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an analyser is used to determine the relative levels of oxygen and carbon dioxide during any dive that is part of the diving operation unless the analyser is recalibrated in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions for that analyser prior to the dive.

Subsection.Text: Where an analyser is used continuously in a diving operation to determine the relative levels of oxygen and carbon dioxide during any dive that is part of the diving operation, the supervisor of the dive shall ensure that the analyser is recalibrated in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions for that analyser, where practicable, every two hours.

No diving supervisor shall, in a diving operation supervised by the supervisor, use or permit to be used an on-line gas blender or a diver’s gas recovery system in the diving operation unless throughout the period that the blender or the diver’s gas recovery system is in use the requirements of section 21 are complied with.
No supervisor shall commence or continue a diving operation unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the total quantity of appropriate breathing mixture that is available at any time during the diving operation consists of the quantities set out in section 22;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the purity of the breathing mixture is of an acceptable standard; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the quantities of breathing mixture referred to in subparagraphs 22(1)(a)(ii) and (iii) are available for immediate use at a flow rate, temperature and pressure that are safe for the user.

Subsection.Text: No supervisor shall permit a diver supervised by the supervisor to make a dive unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the total quantity of appropriate breathing mixture, including the reserve supply,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: carried by the diver is sufficient to enable that diver to reach a skip, diving bell or diving submersible used in connection with the dive, a reserve supply referred to in subparagraph 22(1)(a)(ii) or the surface, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: available to the diver’s stand-by diver for immediate use consists of an adequate quantity to enable the stand-by diver to reach the diver and to enable the stand-by diver and the diver

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: to carry out appropriate decompression procedures and return to the surface, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: to return to the skip, diving bell or diving submersible used in connection with the dive and to carry out appropriate decompression procedures either in that skip, diving bell or diving submersible, as the case may be, or at the surface; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the supervisor has analysed the breathing mixture for the accuracy of its oxygen content immediately prior to the dive.

Subsection.Text: No supervisor shall, in a diving operation supervised by the supervisor, use or permit to be used

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: compressed air as a breathing mixture at water depths greater than 50 m or at pressures that are equivalent to the pressures of water depths greater than 50 m except in the case of a category III dive; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pure oxygen as a breathing mixture except for decompression or therapeutic purposes.

Subsection.Text: A supervisor shall protect any breathing mixture to be used in a diving operation supervised by the supervisor from any likelihood of contamination.

Where a diving supervisor becomes aware of any oil or other contaminant in waters in which a diving operation supervised by the supervisor is being conducted, that supervisor shall take all necessary steps to avoid any contamination of any diver in the water and of the ambient atmosphere in any compression chamber used in the diving operation.
A supervisor shall enter in the diving operations logbook referred to in paragraph 9(5)(m), for each diving operation or portion of a diving operation supervised by the supervisor,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date and the time the diving operation was commenced and terminated including any time during which the diving operation was interrupted, or the date and the time at which the supervisor began the supervision and the time at which that supervision ended;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the diving contractor, if any, who conducted the diving operation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the operator or the operator’s representative responsible for the diving operation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name or other designation and the location of the craft or installation from which, or other dive site at which, the diving operation was conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the identification number of any dive supervised during the diving operation or during the period of supervision referred to in paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the supervisor, the names of all other persons involved in the diving operation including those who operated any diving plant and equipment used in the diving operation, the names of the persons consulted pursuant to paragraph 39(1)(a) and the names of any other persons consulted in respect of the diving operation and the positions or titles of all the persons named;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the procedures followed during the diving operation;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the decompression table and the schedule in that decompression table that were used in the diving operation;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the time at which any diver involved in the diving operation and any skip, diving bell, diving submersible or ADS used in the diving operation left the surface and returned to the surface;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the maximum depth, bottom time, dive time and total dive time for each dive conducted during the period of supervision referred to in paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the type of diving plant and equipment and the type of breathing mixture used in the diving operation;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the type of discomfort, injury or illness, including decompression sickness, suffered by any person involved in the diving operation;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: the particulars of any environmental conditions that affected or might have affected the diving operation; and

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: any other factor relevant to the safety or health of any person involved in the diving operation.

Subsection.Text: A supervisor shall, after completion of an entry in the diving operations logbook in accordance with subsection (1), immediately sign the entry and request the operator or the operator’s representative responsible for the diving operation to countersign the entry as soon as possible.

No person shall make any alteration to an entry in a diving operations logbook referred to in subsection (1) unless the alteration is initialled by the supervisor who made the entry and by the person who countersigned the entry.

The supervisor of a diving operation shall produce, on request, the diving operations logbook for the diving operation for inspection by a conservation engineer pursuant to paragraph 43(b) of the Act.

At the time there is no space for further entries in a diving operations logbook for a diving operation, or at the time the diving operation is completed, whichever occurs first, the supervisor who made the last entry in the logbook shall deliver the logbook to the diving contractor who conducted the diving operation, but, in the event of an accident in connection with the diving operation, the supervisor on duty at the time of the accident shall deliver the logbook to the operator responsible for the diving operation as soon as possible after the accident.
A supervisor shall keep a logbook that is permanently bound, has numbered pages and contains the name and signature of the supervisor and a photograph that is a likeness of the supervisor.

A supervisor shall, as soon as possible after supervision of a dive or after a period of supervision of a portion of a dive, enter in the logbook referred to in subsection (1), for each dive or portion of a dive supervised by the supervisor,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the dive;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the diving contractor, if any, who conducted the dive;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the operator or the operator’s representative responsible for the diving operation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name or other designation and location of the craft or installation from which, or other dive site at which, the dive was conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the dive identification number referred to in paragraph 50(1)(e);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name of each diver or pilot supervised;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the maximum depth, bottom time and dive time of the dive;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the decompression table and the schedule in that decompression table that were used in the dive;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: details of any medical care or advice given and the type of therapeutic treatment used, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: any emergency in connection with the dive; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: any other factor relevant to the safety or health of any person involved in the dive.

Subsection.Text: A supervisor shall, after completion of an entry in the supervisor’s logbook in accordance with subsection (2), immediately sign the entry and request the operator or the operator’s representative responsible for the dive to countersign the entry as soon as possible.

No person shall make any alteration to an entry in a supervisor’s logbook referred to in subsection (1) unless the alteration is initialled by the supervisor and by the person who countersigned the entry.
A supervisor shall produce, on request, the supervisor’s logbook referred to in subsection (1) for inspection by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a conservation engineer pursuant to paragraph 43(b) of the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the diving doctor who examines the supervisor for the purposes of these Regulations, at the time of the examination.

Subsection.Text: A supervisor shall keep in the supervisor’s logbook referred to in subsection (1)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the supervisor’s diving supervisor’s certificate or ADS supervisor’s certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the supervisor’s written appointment as a supervisor pursuant to subsection 9(3);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any certificates or other evidence of qualification in addition to those referred to in paragraph (a); and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any certificates or other evidence of medical examination received from a diving doctor.

Subsection.Text: A supervisor shall retain the supervisor’s logbook referred to in subsection (1) for a period of not less than two years after the day of the last entry made in it.

Where a person involved in a diving operation is in a compression chamber, the supervisor of the diving operation shall keep a record or ensure that a record is kept, at regular intervals of not more than 30 minutes, of the time and the depth gauge readings and of the main components of the atmosphere in the compression chamber, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the oxygen and carbon dioxide; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the temperature and humidity.

Subsection.Text: The supervisor of a diving operation shall keep a record of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the results of any analyses of any breathing mixture used,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any scheduled and unscheduled maintenance performed on any component of the diving plant and equipment used, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the results of any readings taken pursuant to subsection (1),

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: and shall keep a copy of any certifications and inspections carried out on the diving plant and equipment used.

Subsection.Text: On completion of a diving operation, the supervisor of the diving operation shall deliver the records and copies kept pursuant to subsection (2) to the diving contractor who conducted the diving operation.

The supervisor of a diving operation shall make a tape recording of all communications between the divers or the pilots involved in a dive that is part of the diving operation and the supervisor during the pre-dive system check and during the dive and shall retain the tape recording for a minimum of 48 hours after the completion of the diving operation.

Section.Text: No person shall make a category I dive in a diving operation unless the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is 18 years of age or older;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has been certified to be medically fit to dive by a diving doctor who has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: inspected the person’s diver’s logbook referred to in section 63,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: examined the person not more than 12 months prior to the period during which the diving operation is to be conducted, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: recorded the results of the examination including, in the case of a person 35 years of age or older, the results of a stress ECG performance test on a treadmill or a bicycle, on a medical examination record in the form set out in Schedule VII or in another form acceptable to the Minister, and on a diver’s medical certificate in the person’s diver’s logbook;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has delivered a copy of the diver’s medical certificate referred to in paragraph (b) to the diving contractor who conducts the diving operation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: holds

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a valid category I diving certificate issued pursuant to section 54 or 71,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: during the first year in which the person makes category I dives in a diving operation, a valid document that is

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: issued by a country other than Canada on the basis of training and experience that are equivalent to the training and experience referred to in paragraph 54(1)(a), and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: acceptable to the Minister,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a valid category II diving certificate issued pursuant to section 56 or 71 or a valid document referred to in paragraph 55(1)(b), or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a valid category III diving certificate issued pursuant to section 58 or 71 or a valid document referred to in paragraph 57(1)(b); and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: has satisfied the supervisor of the diving operation that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person is capable of using, and has sufficient experience in the use of, the type of diving plant and equipment and breathing mixture to be used in the diving operation and is familiar with the relevant provisions of the procedures manual referred to in paragraph 4(4)(a) and the contingency plan referred to in paragraph 4(4)(i) to be followed in the diving operation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person’s involvement in the diving operation is in no way contrary to any restriction

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: inserted in that person’s diving certificate or attached to that person’s document referred to in paragraph (d) pursuant to section 59, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: inserted in that person’s diver’s medical certificate pursuant to section 60.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on application, issue a category I diving certificate that is valid for one year to a person who has attained a standard of competence in category I diving that is acceptable to the Minister and who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: holds a first-aid certificate acceptable to the Minister and has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: successfully completed, at a school, institution or company acceptable to the Minister, training in the theoretical and practical aspects of diving appropriate to category I diving, including

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the use of air as a breathing mixture,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: surface-oriented diving techniques and operational procedures,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: diving techniques and operational procedures for use with SCUBA,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: the use and operation of any diving plant and equipment, including hand-held tools,

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: the use of communications systems,

Clause.Label: (F)
Clause.Text: the use of decompression tables,

Clause.Label: (G)
Clause.Text: emergency procedures, including hyperbaric first-aid techniques and the operation of surface compression chambers, and

Clause.Label: (H)
Clause.Text: a thorough study of these Regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: made at least 50 dives in various environmental conditions and locations and for various purposes with a bottom time totalling at least 50 hours, including

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: at least 40 dives to depths of up to 20 m with a bottom time totalling at least 43 hours, of which at least 10 were dives to depths of between 15 m and 20 m with a bottom time totalling at least seven hours, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: at least 10 dives to depths of between 20 m and 50 m with a bottom time totalling at least seven hours, of which at least three hours were at depths of between 40 m and 50 m and at least one hour was at a depth of at least 50 m;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: held a category I diving certificate that was issued pursuant to this subsection but is no longer valid because it was not renewed pursuant to subsection (2) and who made at least 28 dives with a bottom time totalling at least 24 hours during the 12 months preceding the application;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: until December 31, 1990, has satisfied the Minister that the person’s training and experience are equivalent to the training and experience described in paragraph (a); or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: holds a valid document referred to in paragraph 53(d).

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on application by the holder of a category I diving certificate issued pursuant to subsection (1), renew the certificate for a period of one year where the holder of the certificate has made at least 24 category I dives with a bottom time totalling at least 20 hours during the 12 months preceding the application.
Subject to subsection (2), no person shall make a category II dive in a diving operation unless the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: meets the criteria set out in paragraphs 53(a) to (c) and (e); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: holds

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a valid category II diving certificate issued pursuant to section 56 or 71,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: during the first year in which the person makes a category II dive in a diving operation, a valid document that is

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: issued by a country other than Canada on the basis of training and experience that are equivalent to the training and experience referred to in paragraph 56(1)(a), and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: acceptable to the Minister, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a valid category III diving certificate issued pursuant to section 58 or 71 or a valid document referred to in paragraph 57(1)(b).

Subsection.Text: A diver who holds a category I diving certificate may make a category II dive for training purposes in a diving operation where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the diver is employed in a diving program on a full-time basis to make category I dives;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the dive is authorized as a training dive by the operator or the operator’s representative responsible for the diving operation and the person in charge of the craft or installation from which the dive will be conducted; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the diver makes the dive under the close supervision of a diver who holds a category II or category III diving certificate.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on application, issue a category II diving certificate that is valid for one year to a person who has attained a standard of competence in category II diving that is acceptable to the Minister and who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: successfully completed, at a school, institution or company acceptable to the Minister, training in the theoretical and practical aspects of diving appropriate to category II diving, including

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the use of mixed gas as a breathing mixture,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: mixed gas diving techniques and operational procedures,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the use and operation of any diving plant and equipment,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: any type of underwater work generally done by a diver,

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: the use of communications systems,

Clause.Label: (F)
Clause.Text: emergency procedures, including hyperbaric first-aid techniques and the operation of compression chambers, and

Clause.Label: (G)
Clause.Text: a thorough study of these Regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: been employed to make category I dives for at least the 12 months preceding the application and has made at least 60 dives in a diving bell or diving submersible with a bottom time totalling at least 20 hours, including at least 30 lock-out dives of which four were to a depth of more than 50 m, two were to a depth of more than 80 m and one was to a depth of 100 m or more, with a bottom time totalling at least 30 minutes per lock-out dive;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: held a category II diving certificate that was issued pursuant to this subsection but is no longer valid because it was not renewed pursuant to subsection (2) and who made at least 28 dives with a bottom time totalling at least 24 hours of which at least 10 dives were category II dives with a bottom time totalling at least 10 hours during the 12 months preceding the application;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: until December 31, 1990, has satisfied the Minister that the person’s training and experience are equivalent to the training and experience described in paragraph (a); or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: holds a valid document referred to in paragraph 55(1)(b).

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on application by the holder of a category II diving certificate issued pursuant to subsection (1), renew the certificate for a period of one year where the holder of the certificate has made at least 24 dives with a bottom time totalling at least 20 hours, including at least eight category II dives with a bottom time totalling at least eight hours during the 12 months preceding the application.
Subject to subsection (2), no person shall make a category III dive in a diving operation unless the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: meets the criteria set out in paragraphs 53(a) to (c) and (e); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: holds a valid category III diving certificate issued pursuant to section 58 or 71 or, during the first year in which the person makes a category III dive in a diving operation, a valid document that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: issued by a country other than Canada on the basis of training and experience that are equivalent to the training and experience described in paragraph 58(1)(a), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: acceptable to the Minister.

Subsection.Text: A diver who holds a category II diving certificate may make a category III dive for training purposes in a diving operation where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the diver is employed in a diving program on a full-time basis to make category II dives;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the dive is authorized as a training dive by the operator or the operator’s representative responsible for the diving operation and the person in charge of the craft or installation from which the dive will be conducted; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the diver makes the dive under the close supervision of a diver who holds a category III diving certificate.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on application, issue a category III diving certificate that is valid for one year to a person who has attained a standard of competence in category III diving that is acceptable to the Minister and who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: successfully completed, at a school, institution or company acceptable to the Minister, training in the theoretical and practical aspects of diving appropriate to category III diving, including

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: at least one saturation dive to a depth of not less than 75 m with at least two lock-out dives with a bottom time totalling at least 30 minutes per lock-out dive,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: saturation diving techniques and operational procedures,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the use and operation of any diving plant and equipment,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: any type of underwater work generally done by a diver,

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: emergency procedures relevant to saturation diving, including hyperbaric first-aid techniques and the operation of compression chambers, and

Clause.Label: (F)
Clause.Text: a thorough study of these Regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: been employed to make category II dives for at least the two years preceding the application and has made at least 24 category II dives;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: held a category III diving certificate that was issued pursuant to this subsection but is no longer valid because it was not renewed pursuant to subsection (2) and who made at least 28 dives with a bottom time totalling at least 32 hours, including at least 10 category II dives with a bottom time totalling at least 10 hours and at least one saturation dive during the 12 months preceding the application;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: until December 31, 1990, has satisfied the Minister that the person’s training and experience are equivalent to the training and experience referred to in paragraph (a); or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: holds a valid document referred to in paragraph 57(1)(b).

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on application by the holder of a category III diving certificate issued pursuant to subsection (1), renew the certificate for a period of one year where the holder of that certificate has made at least 24 dives with a bottom time totalling at least 24 hours, including at least eight category II dives from a diving bell or diving submersible with a bottom time totalling at least eight hours and at least one saturation dive during the 12 months preceding the application.

Heading.TitleText: Restrictions Respecting Diving Certificates and Documents

Subsection.Text: The Minister may insert in a diving certificate issued pursuant to section 54, 56, 58 or 71, or attach to a document referred to in paragraph 53(d), 55(1)(b) or 57(1)(b), restrictions on diving by the holder of the certificate or document where the Minister considers those restrictions necessary for safety reasons.

Where the Minister inserts a restriction in a certificate or attaches a restriction to a document pursuant to subsection (1), the Minister shall give the holder of the certificate or document, an opportunity to show cause why that restriction should not be inserted or attached.

A diving doctor who examines a diver for the purposes of paragraph 53(b) or section 71 may insert in the diver’s medical certificate medical restrictions on diving by the holder of the medical certificate where the diving doctor considers those restrictions necessary for safety reasons.

Where a diving doctor inserts medical restrictions in a diver’s medical certificate pursuant to subsection (1) or certifies in a medical certificate in a diver’s logbook that the diver is medically unfit to dive, the Minister shall, on application by the diver within one month after the insertion or certification by the diving doctor, review that certificate and the diver’s medical examination record related to the certificate with one or more specialized diving doctors.

The Minister may invalidate a diving certificate issued pursuant to section 54, 56, 58 or 71 where, in the opinion of the Minister, the holder of the certificate has become incompetent or incapacitated.

Where the Minister proposes to invalidate a diving certificate pursuant to subsection (1), the Minister shall give the holder of the certificate at least 30 days’ notice in writing setting out the reasons for the proposed invalidation and shall give the holder an opportunity to show cause why the certificate should not be invalidated.
Subject to subsection (2), no diver shall make a dive in a diving operation unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prior to the dive, the diver has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: checked the diver’s personal diving equipment and is satisfied that the equipment is in good working order, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: reported to the supervisor of the diving operation any remedies, treatments, pharmaceuticals, intoxicants or drugs taken by the diver within the 48 hours preceding the dive, any injury or illness experienced by that diver since the diver’s most recent dive and any restrictions imposed pursuant to section 60 by a diving doctor as a result of the diving doctor’s examination of that diver after an injury or illness;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a diver who has experienced an injury or illness other than decompression sickness since the diver’s most recent dive, the diver has received approval for further diving from a diving doctor or a hyperbaric first-aid technician who consulted with a diving doctor concerning the injury or illness;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a diver who has experienced decompression sickness type I, at least two days have elapsed since the diver successfully completed recompression therapy;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a diver who has experienced decompression sickness type II, at least five days have elapsed since the diver successfully completed recompression therapy and the diver has received approval for further diving from a diving doctor; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a diver who has experienced decompression sickness type I in two consecutive dives, the diver has received approval for further diving from a diving doctor.

Subsection.Text: No diver shall make a saturation dive unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a diver whose most recent dive was a saturation dive of 14 days’ duration or less, at least 14 days have elapsed since the diver completed decompression; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a diver whose most recent dive was a saturation dive of more than 14 days’ duration, at least 28 days have elapsed since the diver completed decompression.

Subsection.Text: Where a diver who is employed in a diving operation believes the diver is unfit or unable to dive at any time during that employment, the diver shall so inform the supervisor of the diving operation and shall give the reason for that belief.

Where a diver becomes aware of any oil or other contaminant in waters in which a diving operation is being conducted, the diver shall forthwith inform the supervisor of the diving operation of the contaminant.
A diver shall keep a logbook that is permanently bound, has numbered pages and contains the name and signature of the diver and a photograph that is a likeness of the diver.
A diver shall, as soon as possible after making a dive, enter in the diver’s logbook referred to in subsection (1), for each dive made by the diver,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the dive;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the diving contractor, if any, who conducted the dive;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the operator or the operator’s representative responsible for the dive;
