Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name or other designation and the location of the craft or installation from which, or other dive site at which, the dive was conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the dive identification number referred to in paragraph 50(1)(e);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the supervisor of the dive;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the maximum depth, the bottom time and the total dive time of the dive;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the decompression table and the schedule in that decompression table that were used in the dive;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the decompression procedures followed by the diver;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the type of personal diving equipment used by the diver;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: any injury suffered by the diver during the dive;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the work performed by the diver;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: a description of any discomfort or illness, including decompression sickness, suffered by the diver; and

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: any other factor relevant to the safety or health of the diver.

Subsection.Text: A diver shall, after completion of an entry in the diver’s logbook in accordance with subsection (2), immediately sign the entry and request the supervisor of the dive to countersign the entry as soon as possible.
No person shall make any alteration to an entry in a diver’s logbook referred to in subsection (1) unless the alteration is initialled by the diver and by the supervisor who countersigned the entry.
A diver shall produce, on request, the diver’s logbook referred to in subsection (1) for inspection by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a conservation engineer pursuant to paragraph 43(b) of the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the diving doctor who examines the diver for the purposes of these Regulations, at the time of the examination.

Subsection.Text: A diver shall keep in the diver’s logbook referred to in subsection (1)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the diver’s diving certificate or equivalent document;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any certificates or other evidence of qualification in addition to those referred to in paragraph (a); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any certificates or other evidence of medical examination received from a diving doctor.

Subsection.Text: A diver shall retain the diver’s logbook referred to in subsection (1) for a period of not less than two years after the day of the last entry made in it.

Section.Text: No person shall pilot an ADS in a diving operation unless the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is 18 years of age or older;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has been certified to be medically fit

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: to dive, in accordance with paragraph 53(b), or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: to pilot an ADS, by a medical doctor who has examined the person not more than 12 months prior to the date on which the diving operation is to be conducted and who has recorded the results of the examination on a medical examination record in the form set out in Schedule V or in another form acceptable to the Minister and on a pilot’s medical certificate in that person’s pilot’s logbook referred to in section 69;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has delivered a copy of the medical certificate referred to in paragraph 53(b), or the medical certificate referred to in subparagraph (b)(ii), to the diving contractor who conducts the diving operation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: holds a valid pilot’s certificate issued pursuant to section 65 or 71, or a valid document that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: issued by a country other than Canada on the basis of training and experience that are equivalent to the training and experience described in paragraph 65(1)(a), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: acceptable to the Minister; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: has satisfied the supervisor of the diving operation that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person is capable of using, and has sufficient experience in the use of, the type of ADS and associated equipment to be used in the diving operation and is familiar with the relevant provisions of the procedures manual referred to in paragraph 4(4)(a) and the contingency plan referred to in paragraph 4(4)(i) to be used in the diving operation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person’s involvement in the diving operation is in no way contrary to any restriction

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: inserted in that person’s pilot’s certificate or attached to that person’s document referred to in paragraph (d) pursuant to section 66, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: inserted in that person’s pilot’s medical certificate pursuant to section 60 or 67.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on application, issue a pilot’s certificate that is valid for one year to a person who has attained a standard of competence in the operation of an ADS that is acceptable to the Minister and who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has successfully completed at least 40 hours of technical training in the design, construction, use and maintenance of an ADS at a school, institution or company acceptable to the Minister and who has made at least 25 ADS dives under various conditions with a bottom time totalling at least 40 hours;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: held a pilot’s certificate that was issued pursuant to this subsection but is no longer valid because it was not renewed pursuant to subsection (2) and who has made at least six ADS dives with a bottom time totalling at least 20 hours to an average depth of at least 20 m during the 12 months preceding the application;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: until December 31, 1990, has satisfied the Minister that the person’s training and experience are equivalent to the training and experience described in paragraph (a); or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: holds a valid document referred to in paragraph 64(d).

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, on application by the holder of a pilot’s certificate issued pursuant to subsection (1), renew the certificate for a period of one year where the holder of that certificate has made at least four ADS dives with a dive time totalling at least 16 hours during the 12 months preceding the application.

Heading.TitleText: Restrictions Respecting Pilot’s Certificates and Documents

Subsection.Text: The Minister may insert in a pilot’s certificate issued pursuant to section 65 or 71, or attach to a document referred to in paragraph 64(d), restrictions on the piloting of an ADS by the holder of the certificate or document where the Minister considers those restrictions necessary for safety reasons.

Where the Minister inserts a restriction in a certificate or attaches a restriction to a document pursuant to subsection (1), the Minister shall give the holder of the certificate or document an opportunity to show cause why that restriction should not be so inserted or attached.

A medical doctor who examines a pilot for the purposes of subparagraph 64(b)(ii) or section 71 may insert in the pilot’s medical certificate medical restrictions on the pilot where the doctor considers those restrictions necessary for safety reasons.

Where a medical doctor inserts medical restrictions in a pilot’s medical certificate pursuant to subsection (1) or certifies in a medical certificate in a pilot’s logbook that the pilot is medically unfit to pilot an ADS, the Minister shall, on application by the pilot within one month after the insertion or certification by the doctor, review the certificate and the pilot’s medical examination record related to the certificate with one or more medical doctors.
The Minister may invalidate a pilot’s certificate issued pursuant to section 65 or 71 where, in the opinion of the Minister, the holder of the certificate has become incompetent or incapacitated.

Where the Minister proposes to invalidate a pilot’s certificate pursuant to subsection (1), the Minister shall give the holder of the certificate at least 30 days’ notice in writing setting out the reasons for the proposed invalidation and shall give the holder an opportunity to show cause why the certificate should not be invalidated.
A pilot shall keep a logbook that is permanently bound, has numbered pages and contains the name and signature of the pilot and a photograph that is a likeness of the pilot.
A pilot shall, as soon as possible after making a dive, enter in the pilot’s logbook referred to in subsection (1), for each dive made by the pilot,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the dive;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the diving contractor, if any, who conducted the dive;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the operator or the operator’s representative responsible for the dive;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name or other designation and the location of the craft or installation from which, or other dive site at which, the dive was conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the dive identification number referred to in paragraph 50(1)(e);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the ADS supervisor who supervised the dive;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the maximum depth, the bottom time and the total dive time of the dive;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the work performed by the pilot;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a description of any discomfort, injury or illness suffered by the pilot; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: any other factor relevant to the safety or health of the pilot.

Subsection.Text: A pilot shall, after completion of an entry in the pilot’s logbook in accordance with subsection (2), immediately sign the entry and request the ADS supervisor who supervised the dive to countersign the entry as soon as possible.

No person shall make any alteration to an entry in a pilot’s logbook referred to in subsection (1) unless the alteration is initialled by the pilot and by the ADS supervisor who countersigned the entry.
A pilot shall produce, on request, the pilot’s logbook referred to in subsection (1) for inspection by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a conservation engineer pursuant to paragraph 43(b) of the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the diving doctor or medical doctor who examines the pilot for the purposes of these Regulations, at the time of the examination.

Subsection.Text: A pilot shall keep in the pilot’s logbook referred to in subsection (1)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the pilot’s certificate or equivalent document;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any certificates or other evidence of qualification in addition to those referred to in paragraph (a); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any certificates or other evidence of medical examination received from a diving doctor or medical doctor.

Subsection.Text: A pilot shall retain the pilot’s logbook referred to in subsection (1) for a period of not less than two years after the day of the last entry made in it.

Heading.TitleText: Persons Who Have First-Aid or Medical Training

Subsection.Text: A specialized diving doctor who is involved in a diving operation shall not assume responsibility for any aspect of the operation other than the medical aspect.

A person who has first-aid or medical training and who is employed in a diving operation shall report, without delay, to the supervisor of the diving operation any medical consultation the person had involving a diver or pilot employed in the diving operation and any medical advice or treatment the person provided to the diver or pilot.

Where a person holds a certificate issued by the Minister pursuant to section 28, 30, 32, 34, 54, 56, 58 or 65, or holds a valid document that has been accepted by the Minister pursuant to paragraph 27(c), 29(c), 31(c) or 33(d), for at least five years, the Minister may, on application, issue the person a certificate, for the same category as the certificate or document that was held, that is valid, subject to section 36, 61 or 68, for as long as the person is certified to be medically fit in accordance with paragraph 27(b), 53(b) or 64(b).

Where a person satisfies the Minister that, for any period of five years before the coming into force of these Regulations, the person would have qualified for a certificate under these Regulations if these Regulations had been in force during that period, the Minister may, on application received prior to January 1, 1991, issue the person the certificate that the person would have qualified for, that is valid, subject to section 36, 61 or 68, for as long as the person is certified medically fit in accordance with paragraph 27(b), 53(b) or 64(b).

Section.Text: Any contravention of section 6, 7, 9 to 27, 29, 31, 33, 37 to 53, 55, 57, 62 to 64, 69 or 70 is an offence under the Act.
The procedures manual for a diving program shall contain the standard operating procedures to be followed in any diving operation that will be part of the diving program and shall include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the procedures for any consultations with the person in charge of any craft or installation from which the diving operation is conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the procedures to be followed by each person involved in a dive that will be part of the diving program, including a diver, stand-by diver, pilot, attendant and supervisor;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for each depth and each type of dive, the procedures for

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: conducting the dive, taking into account

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: local meteorological and sea-state conditions, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: hazards such as strong currents, man-made structures and activities, other than diving, being conducted in the vicinity,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the selection of the appropriate breathing mixture, decompression tables and treatment tables to be used in the dive,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the use, inspection and maintenance of the diving plant and equipment, including communications and signalling equipment, to be used in the dive,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the lowering and recovery of a diver and the launching and recovery of any skip, diving bell, diving submersible or ADS to be used in the dive,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the completion of the diving operations logbook referred to in paragraph 9(5)(m) and subsection 50(1), including sample entries, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the making of a decision to commence, continue, interrupt or discontinue the dive, including any conditions to be taken into account in the determination; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a sample of the pre-dive checklist to be followed.

Subsection.Text: The contingency plan for a diving program shall contain the emergency procedures to be followed, where circumstances that are likely to endanger a diver or pilot make it impossible and unsafe to follow the procedures contained in the procedures manual for the diving program, such as

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: deteriorating environmental conditions;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: unexpected weather or sea-state conditions;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: inability of a craft to maintain itself at the location of a dive site;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: evacuation of a craft or installation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: evacuation of divers under pressures greater than atmospheric pressure;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in-water emergency transfers;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: failure of any major component of diving plant or equipment; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: fouling of equipment below the surface that impairs the ability of a diver or pilot to complete a dive.

Subsection.Text: The emergency procedures referred to in subsection (1) shall include procedures for

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: emergency signalling between divers involved in the diving program and between the divers and their attendants using umbilicals or other suitable methods;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the provision of stand-by divers;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the provision of crafts, stand-by boats and any other devices to be used for rescue;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the provision of first-aid treatment and therapeutic decompression;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the use of the evacuation, rescue and treatment facilities and devices referred to in section 23 to be used in the diving program;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: contacting the evacuation, rescue and treatment facilities referred to in section 23 and the medical services referred to in paragraphs 24(b) and (d) that will be used in the diving program;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the operation of the emergency power supply;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the evacuation of a craft or installation used in the diving program;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the evacuation of divers under pressures greater than atmospheric pressure; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: in-water emergency transfers.
